password_security_tips.title: Use Unique Passwords
password_security_tips.description: Use a unique password for each account to prevent unauthorized access if one is compromised.

password_security_tips.title: Avoid Guessable Passwords
password_security_tips.description: Avoid using easily guessable passwords like '123456' or 'password' to enhance security.

password_security_tips.title: Enable Two-Factor Authentication
password_security_tips.description: Enable two-factor authentication whenever possible for an extra layer of protection against unauthorized access.

password_security_tips.title: Regularly Update Passwords
password_security_tips.description: Regularly update your passwords to reduce the risk of them being compromised over time.

password_security_tips.title: Use Passphrases
password_security_tips.description: Use a passphrase instead of a single word for added complexity and security.

password_security_tips.title: Securely Store Passwords
password_security_tips.description: Store passwords securely using a trusted password manager to prevent unauthorized access.

password_security_tips.title: Avoid Sharing Passwords
password_security_tips.description: Avoid sharing passwords via email or text messages to minimize the risk of interception.

password_security_tips.title: Beware of Phishing
password_security_tips.description: Be cautious of phishing attempts and never provide your password in response to unsolicited requests.

password_security_tips.title: Use Complex Passwords
password_security_tips.description: Use a combination of uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters in your passwords for increased complexity.

password_security_tips.title: Keep Password Manager Updated
password_security_tips.description: Keep your password manager software up to date to ensure it has the latest security patches and features.
